required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Permeaderm Versus Homograft for Full-thickness Burns
clinical_study.official_title: Biosynthetic Skin Substitute Versus Frozen Human Cadaver Allograft for Temporary Coverage of Excised Full-thickness Burn Wounds

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

brief_summary.textblock: Frozen Human Cadaver Allograft (FHCA) is, nowadays, the gold standard for temporary coverage of excised full-thickness burns, but is also very expensive and requires additional personnel and major storage spaces in comparison to other products. The purpose of this study is to determine the extent to which PermeaDerm® dressing promotes wound bed maturation when used as a temporary dressing for excised full-thickness burn wounds. Efficacy and safety in promoting wound bed maturation for successive autografting will be determined through direct comparison to FHCA.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this prospective, randomized, matched design pilot study, we aim to compare the current standard of care FHCA to PermeaDerm®.
30 patients for each study arm (n total = 60) meeting the inclusion criteria will be enrolled to randomly receive FHCA and PermeaDerm® on two adjacent or symmetric body areas.
Prior to randomization of study areas and application of study dressings, baseline assessments of wound size and burn depth will be performed by the experienced physician and documented using photography and when indicated laser Doppler (Moor Laser Speckle®, Moor Instruments, Devon, UK) measurements. Percentage of graft take and wound healing after removal of the temporary wound dressings and secondary autografting (study arm 1) or after excision and direct autografting with wiedely-meshed autograft and temporary wound dressings as overlay (study arm 2) will be assessed.
Secondary outcomes will include complications such as infections, signs of rejection/non-adherence, fluid accumulation/hematoma beneath dressings and mid- and long-term clinical scar maturation, as assessed by the POSAS and objectively with the DermaLab Combo® device (Cortex Technology ApS, Hadsund, Denmark).

clinical_study.why_stopped: Protocol was withdrawn and closed by IRB in April, 2018 prior to enrollment of first patient

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized matched design with application of both study dressings symmetrical or adjacent body sites at the same time.
study_design_info.masking_description: Outcomes assessors (healing time and scar assessments) are blinded.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 8 weeks after initial grafting
primary_outcome.description: Time until study areas are 95% healed, as rated by blinded assessors based on photographs

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adherence problems (Arm 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 21 days after initial surgery
secondary_outcome.description: % of non-adherence at first dressing change

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adherence problems (Arm 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 21 days after initial surgery
secondary_outcome.description: % of non-adherence at first dressing change and at time of dressing removal before grafting

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of infections
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 8 weeks after initial grafting
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of infection, defined as >10x5 bacteria/g tissue, Only taken when infection suspected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of fluid/hematoma accumulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 21 days after initial surgery
secondary_outcome.description: % of fluid accumulation/hematoma formation at first dressing change

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost effectiveness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until grafting of study sites, within 21 days
secondary_outcome.description: Price per cm square of each study dressing

secondary_outcome.measure: Scar assessment with Patient and Observer Assessment Scale (POSAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed within 4 weeks after 95% wound healing
secondary_outcome.description: Using Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale POSAS, what is a composite score that is rating the overall appearance of the scar, based on each single score for rating vascularity, pigmentation, thickness, relief, pliability, surface. Every subscore ranges from 1-10. The composite score is calculated as an average of the subscores. Higher numbers mean worse scarring.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scar assessment with Patient and Observer Assessment Scale (POSAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 3 and 9 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Using Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale POSAS, what is a composite score that is rating the overall appearance of the scar, based on each single score for rating vascularity, pigmentation, thickness, relief, pliability, surface. Every subscore ranges from 1-10. The composite score is calculated as an average of the subscores. Higher numbers mean worse scarring.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scar assessment with Patient and Observer Assessment Scale (POSAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 9-15 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Using Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale POSAS, what is a composite score that is rating the overall appearance of the scar, based on each single score for rating vascularity, pigmentation, thickness, relief, pliability, surface. Every subscore ranges from 1-10. The composite score is calculated as an average of the subscores. Higher numbers mean worse scarring.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Viscoelasticity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed within 4 weeks after 95% wound healing
secondary_outcome.description: Measured through negative suction and retraction time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Viscoelasticity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 3 and 9 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Measured through negative suction and retraction time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Viscoelasticity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 9-15 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Measured through negative suction and retraction time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Hydration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed within 4 weeks after 95% wound healing
secondary_outcome.description: Measured based on skin conductance.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 3 and 9 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Measured based on skin conductance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Hydration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 9-15 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Measured based on skin conductance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Pigmentation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed within 4 weeks after 95% wound healing
secondary_outcome.description: Measured based on light absorption of melanin and erythema

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Pigmentation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 3 and 9 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Measured based on light absorption of melanin and erythema

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Pigmentation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 9-15 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Measured based on light absorption of melanin and erythema

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Trans epithermal water loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed within 4 weeks after 95% wound healing
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring evaporation in g/meter square/hour

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Trans epithermal water loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 3 and 9 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring evaporation in g/meter square/hour

secondary_outcome.measure: Scarring with DermaLab Combo device: Trans epithermal water loss
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed between 9-15 months after initial admission
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring evaporation in g/meter square/hour

arm_group.description: A: temporary coverage with PermeaDerm until autografting: After randomization of study site, study dressing will be applied as temporary coverage on freshly excised full-thickness burn wounds.
B: temporary coverage with FHCA until autografting: After randomization of study site, study dressing will be applied as temporary coverage on freshly excised full-thickness burn wounds.
C: temporary coverage of widely meshed autograft with PermeaDerm until healing occurs and PermeaDerm can remove
D: temporary coverage of widely meshed autograft with FHCA until healing occurs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥ 2 % total body surface area (TBSA) full thickness burned.
- Patients with two adjacent or body symmetrical full thickness burned areas (each ≥ 1 TBSA) and comparable in size (TBSA ± 0.5), that require debridement and autografting.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Time from injury to admission >= 5 days
- Sepsis on admission or clinically suspected infection (as per attending physician)
- Pregnancy or childbearing
- Positive HIV or hepatitis screens
- History of active malignancy
- Patients who do not require surgical debridement and autografting
- Patient with burn injuries originating from other causes (chemical, and frostbite)
